questions.question: What is the primary responsibility of a PHV driver before starting a journey?
options: Checking the vehicle's roadworthiness, including fuel, brakes, and lights
Setting the passenger's preferred radio station
Confirming the passenger's home address
Reviewing traffic updates
questions.answer: Checking the vehicle's roadworthiness, including fuel, brakes, and lights

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a legal requirement for PHV drivers?
options: Maintaining a clean and roadworthy vehicle
Holding a valid Hire or Reward insurance policy
Having a first-aid certificate
Displaying the driver’s licence disc in the vehicle
questions.answer: Having a first-aid certificate

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if they suspect a passenger is involved in illegal activity, such as human trafficking?
options: Ignore it
Confront the passenger directly
Report it to the police or relevant authorities
Discuss it with other PHV drivers
questions.answer: Report it to the police or relevant authorities

questions.question: Which of the following is considered discriminatory under the Equality Act 2010?
options: Refusing a passenger based on their disability
Helping a passenger with a guide dog
Offering assistance to wheelchair users
Providing service to all passengers equally
questions.answer: Refusing a passenger based on their disability

questions.question: What is the correct procedure for handling lost property found in a PHV?
options: Keeping it until the passenger calls
Returning it to the operator or local police
Selling it if unclaimed
Ignoring it and continuing work
questions.answer: Returning it to the operator or local police

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if their licence is suspended?
options: Continue working until notified by TfL
Stop working immediately
Drive only during non-peak hours
Work under another operator
questions.answer: Stop working immediately

questions.question: Which of the following actions is NOT allowed when operating a PHV?
options: Using a hands-free device
Taking direct street hires
Following GPS navigation
Helping passengers with disabilities
questions.answer: Taking direct street hires

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if they feel tired while driving?
options: Continue driving carefully
Take a break and rest
Drink coffee and keep going
Reduce speed but keep driving
questions.answer: Take a break and rest

questions.question: What is a PHV driver’s responsibility regarding seat belts?
options: Ensuring all passengers wear seat belts
Only wearing a seat belt themselves
Letting passengers decide whether to wear a seat belt
Providing seat belts only to front-seat passengers
questions.answer: Ensuring all passengers wear seat belts

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if their vehicle breaks down mid-journey?
options: Ask the passenger to leave immediately
Ensure passenger safety and arrange an alternative vehicle
Continue driving until the destination
Ignore the issue and call for help later
questions.answer: Ensure passenger safety and arrange an alternative vehicle

questions.question: Which of the following is required when accepting a booking?
options: Confirming the fare in advance
Ensuring the passenger has the correct change
Confirming the booking through an operator
Asking the passenger for personal details
questions.answer: Confirming the booking through an operator

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if a passenger becomes aggressive?
options: Engage in an argument
Ignore the passenger
Politely ask them to calm down and, if necessary, report it
Drop them off immediately, even if unsafe
questions.answer: Politely ask them to calm down and, if necessary, report it

questions.question: When is a PHV driver required to report a medical condition to TfL?
options: Only if they stop working
If the condition affects their ability to drive
Every 5 years
Only during a licence renewal
questions.answer: If the condition affects their ability to drive

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT required when picking up a passenger?
options: Confirming the passenger’s identity
Checking the destination
Requesting the passenger’s home address
Ensuring seat belts are worn
questions.answer: Requesting the passenger’s home address

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if they suspect human trafficking?
options: Ignore it
Call the police or report it to authorities
Ask the passenger directly
Discuss with other drivers
questions.answer: Call the police or report it to authorities

questions.question: What are the legal requirements for a PHV driver to handle cash payments from passengers?
options: Refuse cash payments
Provide an accurate receipt and handle cash securely
Keep all cash payments without recording them
Charge extra for cash payments
questions.answer: Provide an accurate receipt and handle cash securely

questions.question: What are the specific procedures a PHV driver should follow when encountering road closures or diversions?
options: Ignore road closures and continue on the original route
Follow official diversion signs and inform the passenger of any delays
Ask passengers to direct the route
Turn around and return to the starting point
questions.answer: Follow official diversion signs and inform the passenger of any delays

questions.question: What are the legal requirements for a PHV driver regarding the use of mobile phones while driving?
options: Use a handheld phone while driving
Only use a hands-free device and ensure it does not distract from driving
Use a phone only during breaks
Use a phone to check maps frequently
questions.answer: Only use a hands-free device and ensure it does not distract from driving

questions.question: What are the specific steps a PHV driver must take to ensure passenger privacy and data protection?
options: Share passenger details with friends
Comply with GDPR and data protection laws, and never disclose passenger information without consent
Sell passenger data to marketing companies
Post passenger details on social media
questions.answer: Comply with GDPR and data protection laws, and never disclose passenger information without consent

questions.question: What are the specific procedures a PHV driver should follow when dealing with a passenger who is clearly intoxicated?
options: Refuse to take the booking if the passenger poses a risk to themselves or the driver, and ensure they are safe
Take the passenger regardless of their condition
Take the passenger only if they agree to pay extra
Leave the passenger at the nearest bus stop
questions.answer: Refuse to take the booking if the passenger poses a risk to themselves or the driver, and ensure they are safe

questions.question: What specific information must a PHV driver provide to a passenger who requests their license details?
options: Only the badge number
The full license number and any other relevant information
The operator’s contact details
Only the vehicle registration
questions.answer: The full license number and any other relevant information

questions.question: What are the legal requirements for a PHV driver to ensure the safety of children in their vehicle?
options: Children must sit in the front seat
Children must use appropriate child seats or restraints as required by law
Children can sit on an adult’s lap
Children under 12 do not require a seatbelt
questions.answer: Children must use appropriate child seats or restraints as required by law

questions.question: What is the detailed process for a PHV driver to report lost property left in their vehicle?
options: Keep the property until the passenger contacts them
Report the lost property to the operator and follow their procedures, or report it to the police if valuable
Dispose of the property after 24 hours
Sell the property online
questions.answer: Report the lost property to the operator and follow their procedures, or report it to the police if valuable

questions.question: What specific actions should a PHV driver take if they suspect a passenger is involved in illegal activity?
options: Confront the passenger directly
Report the suspicion to the police and the operator immediately
Ignore the suspicion unless directly involved
Inform other passengers
questions.answer: Report the suspicion to the police and the operator immediately

questions.question: What are the legal requirements for a PHV driver to handle complaints from passengers?
options: Ignore any complaints
Listen to the complaint, provide contact details for the operator, and report the complaint to the operator
Argue with the passenger
Offer a discount to resolve the complaint
questions.answer: Listen to the complaint, provide contact details for the operator, and report the complaint to the operator

questions.question: What are the detailed requirements for a PHV driver to maintain the cleanliness of their vehicle?
options: Only clean the outside of the vehicle
Maintain a clean and tidy interior and exterior, ensuring passenger comfort and hygiene
Only clean the vehicle once a week
Only clean the vehicle if a passenger complains
questions.answer: Maintain a clean and tidy interior and exterior, ensuring passenger comfort and hygiene

questions.question: What are the legal implications of a PHV driver refusing to transport a passenger with a guide dog?
options: It is allowed if the driver has allergies
It is illegal and constitutes discrimination under the Equality Act 2010
It is allowed with a written notice
It is allowed if the passenger pays extra
questions.answer: It is illegal and constitutes discrimination under the Equality Act 2010

questions.question: What are the specific procedures a PHV driver should follow in the event of a vehicle breakdown?
options: Leave the vehicle and walk away
Ensure passenger safety, contact the operator, and arrange for alternative transport if necessary
Ask passengers to push the vehicle
Attempt to fix the vehicle immediately
questions.answer: Ensure passenger safety, contact the operator, and arrange for alternative transport if necessary

options: Refuse cash payments
Provide an accurate receipt and handle cash securely
Keep all cash payments without recording them
Charge extra for cash payments

Only use a hands-free device and ensure it does not distract from driving

Comply with GDPR and data protection laws, and never disclose passenger information without consent

questions.question: What can you expect when someone has taken drugs or alcohol?
options: They will behave normal
They will be aggressive
It can affect their ability to think or communicate clearly and their behavior can be difficult to predict. In cases, they may become aggressive.
questions.answer: It can affect their ability to think or communicate clearly and their behavior can be difficult to predict. In cases, they may become aggressive.

questions.question: When you are recording an incident you should try and include the following details (Select 2 correct answers)
options: Your gender
Information about the attacker (name, address if known, description of clothing, age, gender)
Brief description of the incident
answer: Information about the attacker (name, address if known, description of clothing, age, gender)

questions.question: What information has the section on Staying Safe covered?
options: How to keep yourself safe - keeping passengers safe is not your responsibility
How to keep both you and your passengers safe
How to avoid damaging your PHV
questions.answer: How to keep both you and your passengers safe

questions.question: Do you need to display signs about CCTV in operation?
options: Yes, signage must be displayed but not in a visible place
Yes, signage must be displayed somewhere that is easy for passengers to see
No
questions.answer: Yes, signage must be displayed somewhere that is easy for passengers to see

questions.question: You should never make comments or jokes about someone's (Select 2 correct answers)
options: Football team, political views
Age, race, religion
Disability, sexual orientation or gender identity
answer: Disability, sexual orientation or gender identity

questions.question:
Installing CCTV cameras into a vehicle can reduce threats and violence against drivers. Signs in the vehicle informing passengers that CCTV is used may also help to prevent aggressive or violent behaviour. You can buy a camera or rent one. Although this is an extra cost, having a CCTV camera may reduce insurance premiums. This is because a video recording can be useful evidence when there is a dispute with a passenger.

Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: Signs in the vehicle informing passengers that CCTV is used may also help to prevent aggressive or violent behaviour
Having a CCTV camera in your vehicle will not reduce insurance premiums.
A video recording is not useful evidence when there is a dispute with a passenger
questions.answer: Signs in the vehicle informing passengers that CCTV is used may also help to prevent aggressive or violent behaviour

questions.question: Sexual behaviour between you and a passenger is?
options: Only acceptable if you both agree to it
Only acceptable if you both agree to it and it takes place after completion of the journey
Not acceptable even if you both agree to it
questions.answer: Not acceptable even if you both agree to it

questions.question: What information has the section about Driver Behaviour covered?
options: How TfL expects drivers to behave towards passengers and other road users
How TfL expects drivers to behave during Topographical assessments
How TfL expects operators to manage the drivers who work for them
questions.answer: How TfL expects drivers to behave towards passengers and other road users

questions.question: You should never? (Select 2 correct answers)
options: Look at or speak to a passenger in a way that makes them feel uncomfortable, for example staring at any part of their body
Make any political or football-related comments
Make any sexual remarks or comments about a passenger’s appearance or clothing
answer: Look at or speak to a passenger in a way that makes them feel uncomfortable, for example staring at any part of their body
Make any sexual remarks or comments about a passenger’s appearance or clothing

questions.question: You as a PHV driver have the responsibility to?
options: Make sure that your air-conditioning is ON
Make sure your passengers feel safe when they travel in your vehicle
Know all routes in central London
questions.answer: Make sure your passengers feel safe when they travel in your vehicle

questions.question:
You should never accept any bad behaviour towards you for any reason. Any offensive or violent behaviour towards you because of your race, faith, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity is a hate crime. If you experience or witness this type of behaviour TfL urges you to report it to the police so that it can be fully investigated and action taken against the offender.

Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: Angry or violent behaviour from passengers is acceptable
Any offensive or violent behaviour towards you because of your race, faith, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity is a hate crime
You should always be prepared to accept bad behaviour towards you for any reason.
questions.answer: Any offensive or violent behaviour towards you because of your race, faith, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity is a hate crime
